title: Recitations
content:
The Recitations are from the course textbook:
Apostol, Tom M. Calculus, Volume 1: One-Variable Calculus, with An Introduction to Linear Algebra. Waltham, Mass: Blaisdell, 1967. ISBN: 9780471000051.
REC # ASSIGNMENTS 1 Pg 16: 10, 15, 18 2 Pg 18: prove Th’m I.9, I.10; pg 19: 4 3 Prove Th’m I.24; pp 35-36: 1a,11; pg 40: 6, 11 4 A.9:3; pg 28: 3; pg 43: 1achi 5 Pg 57: 9abc, 11; pg 63:1ab, 4a 6 Pg 70: 1bcde, 2,3; prove theorem 1.2 7 Pg 70: 4,10; prove theorem 1.5 8 Pg 83: 24; prove theorem 1.6 9 Pg 84: 25; course notes: E.3:1 10 (1) Using an argument involving ε, δ, show that f(x) = 1/x is continuous at x = 2. (For any ε, find a δ that will suffice. You can expect that δ will depend on both ε and the fact that you are doing this near x = 2.)
(2) Be prepared to present problems from the practice exam.
